alert.note: Alert for Chesterfield; City of Richmond; Hanover; Henrico (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 24 at 2:32AM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Virginia, including the following counties and independent city, Chesterfield, City of Richmond, Hanover and Henrico. * WHEN...Until 430 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 232 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Richmond, Virginia Commonwealth University, Virginia Union University, Downtown Richmond, Highland Springs, Mechanicsville, Bon Air, Tuckahoe, East Highland Park, Bensley, Lakeside, Bellwood, Glen Allen, Montrose, Richmond Heights, Fair Oaks, Chamberlayne, Richmond International, Drewrys Bluff and Dumbarton. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: Chesterfield; City of Richmond; Hanover; Henrico
